entry.et: Middle English, from Anglo-French aluer, alouer to place, apportion, allow, from Middle French allocare allocate

def.dt: :to assign as a share or suitable amount (as of time or money) allow an hour for lunch
:to reckon as a deduction or an addition allow a gallon for leakage
:to express an opinion usually used with as how or that
:admit concede must allow that money causes problems in marriage
:permit doesn't allow people to smoke in his home
:to forbear or neglect to restrain or prevent allow the dog to roam
:to make a possibility :admit used with of evidence that allows of only one conclusion
:to give consideration to circumstances or contingencies used with for allow for expansion
